intro: Specularia parviflora subsp. balearica, commonly known as the Balearic sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant features small, delicate white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, adapted to the dry, rocky environments it inhabits. It is often found in coastal areas and limestone soils, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
